intro: Thelasis obtusa, commonly known as the broadleaf thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy structure. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with broad, silvery-green leaves that have a rough texture. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Thelasis obtusa is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
